Interface DataBase

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BooksDataBase, DataBaseAbstract, UsersDataBase

    public interface DataBase
    The DataBase interface represents a general database and gives skeleton structure of methods every database must implement

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addRecord(Record record)
      Adds a Record to the database

      Replaces an old Record with a new Record

      Finds a Record in the database
      int numberOfFields()

      Removes a Record from the database

    • Method Detail

      • addRecord

        boolean addRecord(Record record)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds a Record to the database
        Parameters:
        record - The Record to be added
        Returns:
        true on success and false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if problems with opening or appending the file

              throws java.lang.Exception
        Removes a Record from the database
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true on success and false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if problems with opening or appending the file

      • findRecord

        Record findRecord(Record record)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Finds a Record in the database
        Parameters:
        record - The Record to be found
        Returns:
        Record on success and null otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if problems with opening or appending the file
